Branching Files

You branch revisions to create a separate line of development that diverges from a revision on the trunk (main line of development) or from another branch.

To create a branch by checking in a non-tip revision:

  1. From the Revision pane, select the non-tip revision that you want to use as the starting point of the branch.

  2. Select Actions | Check Out. The Check Out File dialog box appears.

  3. Click OK. A confirmation dialog box warns that locking the selected revision will create a branch when the revision is checked in and asks if you wish to check out the file anyway.

  4. Click Yes. Version Manager checks out the revision to the location currently set as the workfile location and places a lock on the revision.

  5. Modify the workfile as necessary and save your changes.

  6. To check the workfile back in to the archive, select Actions | Check In. The Check In dialog box appears.

  7. Enter a change description in the Description field.

  8. Click OK. Version Manager creates a branch from the non-tip revision and displays the branches (illustrated by the branch icon ) and assigns it the branch point revision number followed by 1.*, and assigns the initial branch revision the branch point revision number followed by 1.0.


To force a branch at the tip revision:

  1. From the Revision pane, select the tip revision you want to use as the starting point of the branch.

  2. Select Actions | Check Out. The Check Out File dialog box appears.

  3. Click OK. The tip revision is checked out and locked.

  4. Modify the workfile as necessary and save your changes.

  5. Select Actions | Check In. The Check In dialog box appears.

  6. Enter a change description in the Description field.

  7. Click the Advanced tab and select the Force branch check box.

  8. Click OK. Version Manager creates a branch from the tip revision and displays the branches (illustrated by the branch icon ) in the Revision pane.


To create a branch by checking in a revision with multiple locks:

To check in a revision with multiple locks, you must first enable your project/project database for multiple locking.
  1. From the Revision pane, select a locked revision.

  2. To apply a secondary lock, select Actions | Check Out or Actions| Lock. The Check Out File or Lock File dialog box appears.

  3. Click OK. A confirmation dialog box warns that the revision is already locked and asks if you want apply an additional lock.

  4. Click Yes. A second confirmation dialog box warns that locking the selected revision will force a branch when the revision is checked in and asks if you wish to lock or check out the file anyway.

  5. Click Yes. Version Manager checks out or locks the revision.

  6. Modify the workfile as necessary and save your changes.

  7. Select Actions | Check In. The Check In dialog box appears.

  8. Enter a change description in the Description field.

  9. Click OK. Because you are checking in a workfile with multiple locks, the Select Revision dialog box appears.

  10. From the New Revision drop-down list, select the revision number that will create a new branch when the workfile is checked in.

  11. Click OK. Version Manager creates a branch from the revision and displays the branches (illustrated by the branch icon ) in the Revision pane.
